column2: ALABAMA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Alabama
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: your tires do not have as much traction.
column6: you should use cruise control to increase traction.
column8: you should keep your eyes moving.

column2: 2. If your wheels drop off the pavement edge, you should:
column4: stop.
column6: turn back onto the roadway immediately.
column8: turn gradually back onto the roadway when safe.

column2: 3. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: slow down to allow traffic to enter.
column6: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
column8: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.

column2: 4. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 5. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column6: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.

column2: 6. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: after making a complete stop first.
column6: if you wait until the light changes.
column8: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.

column2: 7. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.
column8: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 8. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 9. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.
column6: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 10. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column4: waiting several hours.
column6: taking a cold shower.
column8: getting a cup of coffee.

column2: 11. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column6: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column8: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Hairpin corner ahead.
column6: Warning: U-turn ahead.
column8: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 13. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Whoever enters the intersection first.
column6: You.
column8: The car on your right.

column2: 14. This sign indicates:
column4: Warning: drunk drivers.
column6: Winding road. Drive with caution.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 15. Large trucks:
column4: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column6: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
column8: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.

column2: 16. This warning sign:
column4: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.

column2: 17. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column6: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.

column2: 18. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, always.
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: No, never.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No right turn
column8: No U-turns

column2: 20. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 21. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.
column6: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
column8: keep a safe following distance.

column2: 22. The picture shows:
column4: a railroad advance warning sign.
column6: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Right lane closed
column6: Do not block intersection
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Warning, crossroad ahead
column6: All traffic must turn
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 25. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.
column6: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column8: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.

column2: 26. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 27. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it has just begun to rain.
column8: When it's been raining from at least one hour.

column2: 28. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)
column6: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 29. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: avoid drinking coffee.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column4: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane
column6: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column8: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less

column2: 31. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: carefully drive around them.
column6: stop until the person is well away from the roadway or path of travel.
column8: honk their horn as they proceed past them.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing
column6: Playground ahead
column8: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 33. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: wear approved helmets.

column2: 34. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: reduce the minimum following distance.
column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: All traffic must go straight ahead
column8: All traffic must turn right

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: You must bear either right or left
column8: A 3-way intersection is ahead

column2: 37. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
column4: Stop
column6: Pass with caution
column8: Do not pass

column2: 38. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 39. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Make eye contact.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 40. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
